attributes.description: Defines the type of refrigerant used in the cooling system for optimal heat exchange.
attributes.name: coolantType

attributes.description: Maximum cooling capacity delivered by the cooling system to maintain cabin comfort.
attributes.name: coolingCapacity

attributes.description: Operational temperature threshold required for initiating cooling processes.
attributes.name: operationalTemperature

attributes.description: Response time from sensor detection to actuation of cooling processes.
attributes.name: responseTime

attributes.description: Expected ambient pressure range within which the cooling system operates reliably.
attributes.name: operationalPressure

designScenario.description: The Cooling System is a specialized subsystem within the Environmental Control architecture of passenger airplanes. It is engineered to provide rapid and efficient regulation of cabin temperature by utilizing an advanced refrigeration cycle integrated with precise sensor feedback and automated control. This system employs state-of-the-art compressors, evaporator coils, and fan assemblies to achieve uniform cooling distribution, ensuring passenger comfort and safety even during extreme environmental conditions.
designScenario.name: Cooling System

details.description: The system shall reduce and maintain cabin air temperature below 22°C using high-efficiency refrigeration cycles and coordinated air distribution.
The system shall achieve a cooling response within 4 seconds from temperature deviation detection to actuator response.
In the event of component malfunction such as compressor failure, the system shall engage redundant measures and alert the control unit, ensuring safety protocols are activated.
The Cooling System shall be modular, allowing for hot-swappable components and simplified maintenance procedures, with an interface designed for ease-of-use by flight crew.

relationships.description: The Cooling Control Module aggregates sensor data and regulates the operation of the refrigeration compressor.
The Refrigeration Compressor is dependent on control signals issued by the Cooling Control Module to initiate the cooling cycle.
The Evaporator Coil Unit works in association with the Air Distribution Fan to ensure uniformly cooled air is circulated throughout the cabin.
The Cooling Control Module is composed of integrated subcomponents that include the Temperature Sensor and Communication Module for real-time monitoring.

systemComponents.description: A high-efficiency refrigeration unit that compresses refrigerant to initiate the cooling cycle, crucial for the temperature regulation process.
systemComponents.name: Refrigeration Compressor

subComponents.description: Electric motor and piston assembly that compresses the refrigerant gas.
subComponents.name: Compressor Motor

subComponents.description: Pressure regulator that modulates refrigerant pressure during the compression cycle.
subComponents.name: Pressure Regulator

systemComponents.description: An evaporator coil assembly that absorbs heat from the cabin air, facilitating the cooling process.
systemComponents.name: Evaporator Coil Unit

subComponents.description: Coil structure through which refrigerant circulates to extract heat efficiently.
subComponents.name: Cooling Coil

systemComponents.description: Fan assembly designed to circulate cooled air throughout the aircraft cabin, ensuring uniform temperature distribution.
systemComponents.name: Air Distribution Fan

subComponents.description: High-speed fan blades optimized for effective air movement.
subComponents.name: Primary Fan

subComponents.description: Secondary duct system to direct air flow to critical zones.
subComponents.name: Air Ducts

systemComponents.description: Electronic control module that manages the switching and modulation of cooling processes based on sensor inputs.
systemComponents.name: Cooling Control Module

subComponents.description: Processor unit that interprets temperature sensor data and issues control commands.
subComponents.name: Control Processor

subComponents.description: User interface display for pilots to monitor cooling system status.
subComponents.name: Display Interface

subComponents.description: Communication interface that enables remote monitoring and inter-module coordination.
subComponents.name: Communication Module

subComponents.description: Dedicated temperature sensor for monitoring the effectiveness of cooling within the subsystem.
subComponents.name: Temperature Sensor (Cooling)

constraintBlocks.expression: temperatureCommand > -10 and temperature-treshold defines if chamber within adequate range.
constraintBlocks.name: TemperatureUnderSetValueFlagi
